englishTitle: THE POEMS OF William of Shoreham,: AB. 1320 VICAR OF CHART-SUTTON.: PART I. PREFACE, INTRODUCTION, TEXT, AND NOTES.

0.0: SOnderliche his man astoned In his owene mende, Wanne he not e neuer wannes he comþe, Ne wider he schel wende; And more, In the MS. the 'bob' of every stanza is written in the margin to the right of the first line, a curved line running down from the rime-word of the 'bob' to the corresponding one of the last line. Þet al his lyf his here imengde Wiþe sorwe and eke wiþe sore.
0.1: ¶ And wanne he deiþe, ne mey me wite Woder he comeþ to wisse; Bote as a stock þer liþe þet body, Wiþe-þoute alle manere blisse. Wat þenkeste? þenkeste [: lengeste ], phonetically þengste [: lengste ]. And hondred winter &yogh;ef a leueþe, And hondred for An h . Þat his lyf mid þe lengeste.
0.2: ¶ Onneþe creft eny þat stat, Ac some crefteþ þat halue; And for siknesse lechecreft, And for þe goute sealue Me makeþe; For wanne man drawiþ in-to oldeward, Wel ofte his bones akeþ.
0.3: ¶ And be a man neuer so sprind, &YOGH;ef he schel libbe to elde, Be him wel siker, þer-to he schel, And his deþes dette &yogh;elde; In deþes, y is written over the first e in a later hand. To gile &YOGH;et meni &yogh;ong man weneþ longe leue, And leueþ wel litle wyle.
0.4: ¶ Þos we beþ al awey-ward, Þat scholde her byleue; And &yogh;et me seiþ ydemyd we beþe In Adam and ine Eue Te helle : helle , MS. telle . Wa&yogh;t hope his here of sauuement sauuement , above it soule sauacioun, written with pencil by a later hand. Now time his for to telle.
0.5: ¶ Me seiþe þe ri&yogh;te wone&yogh;yng Ine heuene hyt his to manne; Ac heuene his hei&yogh;e, and we beþ heuy, Howe scholde we þider þanne? Bi leddre. Howe mey þat be? wo dar þer-oppe stei&yogh;e, For dou&yogh;te of fotes bleddre?
0.6: ¶ Man, þy laddre nys nau&yogh;t of wode þy , read þys ? Þat may to heuene leste; Ac on þer his, þat iakob isei&yogh;e Þer he sleppe inne hys reste. Now schewe þis: Þis ilke laddre is charite, Þe stales gode þeawis.
0.7: ¶ Her-on ihesus stawe vppe bi-fore, Al for to teche ous sty&yogh;e; sty&yogh;e , MS. stey&yogh;e . Nowe hy&yogh;e, man, and folwe wel, folwe , MS. ffolwe , with a faint &yogh; over the w . A-doun þat þou ne sy&yogh;e By-weyled; For yf þou nelt nau&yogh;t climme þos, Of heuene þou hest yfayled.
0.8: ¶ And þat man louye god and man, þat , read þa&yogh; ? Ase charite hyt hoteþ; Þat he so wel yþeawed be, þat , read þa&yogh; ? Þat alle men hit noteþe: Wat þanne? &YOGH;et senne-les ne may he nau&yogh;t be, Ac a deyþe, and he not wanne.
0.9: ¶ Of brokele kende his þat he deiþe, For hy ne mo&yogh;e nau&yogh;t dury; And aldey he to senne falleþ, Her ne mo&yogh;e nau&yogh;t pury mo&yogh;e , o&yogh; on erasure. Of serewnessche. w over en; see note. &YOGH;et hope þou wel, man, for al þis, Þat go&yogh;de lyf wole þe wessche. The &yogh; in go&yogh;de small and indistinct.
0.10: ¶ For deþe ne fall nau&yogh;t into wanhope, MS. into . For god him self for þe deide; Þe þridde day he aros a&yogh;eyn Of þe þrou&yogh; þer men hine leyde, Ine tokene Þat, man, þi body arise schel Of deiþe, nan more to blokne.
0.11: ¶ Þe bible seyþe þat mannys blod blod , MS. blodis . Hys ry&yogh;t þer saule giste; þer on erasure. And water wasscheþ þe felthe a-wey, Þer me wesscheþ by liste Þe on-sounde: To wesschen ous cryst schedde his blod And water out of hys wonde.
0.12: ¶ Here-of spronge þe sacremens Of holy chyrche digne; And his to segge sacrement Of holy þynge signe. For gode, Hou my&yogh;te fayrer signe be Þane of þe water and blode?
0.13: ¶ Man, þorwe þat blod þi soule his bou&yogh;t Fram þe fendes powere; And þorwe þat water iwessche þart Of þyne sennes here. Nou loke, &YOGH;oure Cristendom his tokene þrof &yogh;oure, ur in a smaller handwriting, evidently a later addition to what looks more like &yogh;a than &yogh;o . Of criste þat we toke.
0.14: ¶ For, &yogh;ef þou uangest þane cristendom, And for þan bi-lef[s]t clene, Þou schelt be marked to þet stede stede , in a later hand on erasure. To wichen heuen his ymene; To soþe, Wanne þe bisschop bisschopeþ þe, Tokene of marke he set to þe. MS. tooþe , second o inserted by a later hand.
0.15: ¶ Ac cristendom hys sacrement Of so grete powere, Þat hit þorwe wasscheþ þane man Of senne alle manere; MS. in alle manere, in later addition, above the line. And glorie Hit scheppeþ, &yogh;ef man deyþe, And schilt fram purgatorie.
0.16: ¶ And—for we beþ of nonn power To weryen ous fram schame— Þer der no fend acombry ous, Crist is mid ous to-same(s); And neade: Tokene þer-of his goddes bodi At cherche ine forme of brede.
0.17: ¶ And &yogh;et,—for man his so brotel Ine his owene kende— Þa&yogh; he torni to senne a&yogh;en Þorwe fondyng of þe feende, By chaunce Þat he may come to stat a-&yogh;eyn Þorwe bare repentaunce.
0.18: ¶ Her-of we habbeþ tokene gode, Wanne we fangeþ penaunce For sennes þat we habbeþ idon, To pynes allegaunce Ine fere; MS. first pynes, s nearly gone. For þer we scholde hit vnder-go, Bote we pinede hit here. Bote , MS. Sote .
0.19: ¶ Þat man ne falle ine wanhope A-last wiþ-oute bote, bote, te on erasure. Al þat he heþ iseneged her Wiþ honden and wiþ fo&yogh;te, Wyþ þoute, Mouþe, nase, and earen, and wiþ si&yogh;t, earen , MS. ey&yogh;en; see note. Eliinge brengeþ hit to nou&yogh;te.
0.20: ¶ &YOGH;et some heþe suche deuocioun, Þat hym þingþe he his al ydel For to libbe commun lif, Bote &yogh;ef he hedde a brydel; Bote , MS. Dote . Wet þinge Of harder stat god graunteþ, Wel tokne þrow&yogh; his ordini[n]ge. See note.
0.21: ¶ &YOGH;et, þa&yogh; man mowe nau&yogh;t lecherie þa&yogh; , MS. þat . Forbere to donne ine dede, &YOGH;et ne schal he nau&yogh;t be for-lore, For god &yogh;efþe hym to rede MS. hi (underdotted) after god . Spousynge; Tokene þrof his þe wedding At cherche, and biterewþing. MS. bitere wying , which may mean bitrewying . For the parasitic e , cp. scherewen ( = schrewen ), Sh. p. 143, l. 380; cleregye , Ay. 81; chereche , KS. 31.
0.22: ¶ Cristendom, and bisschoppying, Penauns, and eke spousinge, Godes body ine forme of bred, Ordre, and Aneliinge, Þes seuene Heþ holicherche sacremens, Þat beþ tokenen of heuene.
0.23: ¶ God wescht, and markeþ, and for&yogh;efþ, and for&yogh;efþ begins next line in MS. And ioyneþ men an wyues, And freuereþ þorwe his body man, And grace sent, and lyues. &YOGH;e, wanne? Wanne we takeþ þe sacremens, Þar we seþ hit þanne. seþ on erasure.
0.24: ¶ Þa&yogh; we ne mowe hyt nau&yogh;t ise, þa&yogh; , MS. þat . Ne forþe ine bodie iurede, iurede , MS. inrede . We seþe hit wel ine oure fey, And fredeþ hit at nede Wel e&yogh;aþe: God þorwe miracles keþeþ hit A lyue and eke a deþe.
0.25: ¶ And bote he þorwe hys sacremens Ous þos bi-redde, Ne scholde we of his grace wite Wanne we hit toke and hedde hedde , MS. hadde . To wisse; Þer-fore, he þat bi-lefeþ hit nau&yogh;t Ri&yogh;t wyt neþ of blisse. MS. Ri&yogh;t wyt neþ he of none blisse, he and none written by a later hand above the line, the former between neþ and of , the latter after blisse , with a mark before it, and a corresponding one before blisse , to indicate the place of insertion.
0.26: ¶ Al hit beþ cherche sacremens MS. beþ in cherche þese sacremens, in and þese in a later hand above the line; þese is written in the margin after sacremens , but marked for insertion before it. Þet tokeneþ holi þynges, As hali water, and haly bred, Li&yogh;t, and belryngynges s in belryngynges added by a later hand. To leste; And of alle oþer sacremens Þes seuene beþ þe greste.

1.1: CRistendom his þat sacrement Þat men her ferst fongeþ; MS. ous to . Hit openeþ to ous þe heuene blisse, Þat many man after longeþ Wel sore; For who þat entreþ þer He his sauff euere more.
1.2: ¶ Nou ferst ich wille telle &yogh;ou Wet may be þe materie Wer-inne cristning may be mad, Þat bringeþ ous so merie To honoure: Hi&yogh;t mo&yogh;t be do ine kende water, And non oþer licour[e].
1.3: ¶ Þer-fore ine wine me ne may, Inne siþere, ne inne pereye, Ne ine þing þat neuere water nes Þor&yogh; cristning man reneye; MS. may in a later hand above the line, between man and reneye . Ne inne ale, For, þie hi&yogh;t were water ferst, Of water neþ hit tale.
1.4: ¶ Ne mede, ne forþe no oþer licour Þat chaungeþ wateres kende, Ne longeþ nau&yogh;t to cristendom, Þa&yogh;t some foles hit wende þa&yogh;t, originally þat , as it seems, &yogh; inserted by a later hand. For wete; For suich is kendeliche hot, Þa&yogh;t þer no feer hit ne hete. hete (from hætan ), MS. hente .
1.5: ¶ Ac water is kendeliche cheld, Þa&yogh; hit be warmd of fere; þa&yogh; corrected from þat .— d in warmd in a later hand. Þer-fore me mey cristni þer-inne, In whaut time falþe a &yogh;ere Of yse; So mey me nau&yogh;t in ewe ardaunt, Þat neþ no wateris wyse.
1.6: ¶ Al-so me may inne sealte se Cristny wel mitte beste, And eke inne oþere sealte watere, Bote me in to moche kes(ch)te Of sealte; For &yogh;ef þat water his kende lest, Þat cristning stant te tealte.
1.7: ¶ Ac &yogh;yf þer were ymengd licour Oþer wid kende wetere, wetere , MS. watere . Ich wo&yogh;t wel, þrinne to cristnye Hit nere nefur þe betere, Ac wonde; For bote þat water his kende haue, Þat cristnynge may nau&yogh;t stonde.
1.8: ¶ In water ich wel þe cristny her, As gode him self hyt di&yogh;te; For mide to wessche nis noþynge Þat man comeþ to so li&yogh;te; In londe Nis non þat habben hit ne may: Þat habbe hit wile, founde. founde = fonde .
1.9: ¶ Þis beþe þe wordes of cristnyng Bi þyse englissche costes:— "Ich cristni þe ine þe uader name, And sone, and holy gostes;" And more, "Amen!" Wane hit his ised þer-toe, Confermeþ þet to-fore. MS. þet ( þer ) to-fore, þer added in the margin above fore , a caret being put between þet and to .
1.10: ¶ Þe wordes scholle be ised Wiþe-oute wane and eche; And onderstand, hi mo&yogh;e bi sed mo&yogh;e , MS. more . In alle manere speche Ine lede, Þat euerich man hi sigge mo&yogh;e, mo&yogh;e , MS. more . And cristny for nede.
1.11: ¶ Ac &yogh;if man scholde icristnid be Þat neþ none deaþes signe, Þe pope for te cristny hyne So nere nau&yogh;t te digne Þe leste; Þer-fore hi beþ in cherche brou&yogh;t To cristny of þe preste.
1.12: ¶ Ac he þat &yogh;if so large water he, h in a later hand on erasure.— &yogh;if , read &yogh;ifþ ? or &yogh;ef ? cf. l. 270. Þe fend fram ous te reaue, In nede for to cristny men &YOGH;ef alle men ileaue At felle; Olepi mot hym ine þe water, MS. Olepi (me) mot hym (depe) ine þe water, me and depe added above the line; see note. And eke þe wordes telle.
1.13: ¶ And wanne hi cristneþ ine þe foun&yogh;t, Þe prestes so þries depeþ, MS. Þe so prestes , with marks of transposition. The e in þe seems to have been altered from original i , the stroke over it being still visible. The original reading may possibly have been þise prestes .— depeþ , MS. duppeþ . In þe honur of þe trinite, Ac gode &yogh;eme kepeþ Þe ned On time a cloþe þat water ikest, Ac ope þe heuede te bede. 278-280. See note.
1.14: ¶ Ac water ikest an oþer leme leme (limb), MS. lone (or loue ). Cristneþ þe man alyue, Ac hit his sikerest in þe heeued, Þer beþ þe wittes fyue. Wel, broþer, b and þ in broþer on erasure, in a later hand. Ne non ne may icristned be Ar he his boren of moder. he , MS. &yogh;e.

1.16: ¶ Bote hi þis conne, hit his peril Bote , MS. Dote . To þise medewyues; For ofte children scheawiþ quike, Ibore to schorte lyues, And deyeþ: Bote hi ari&yogh;t icristned be, Fram heuene euere hi weyeþ.
1.17: ¶ Ac &yogh;if þat child icristned his, Ac me fot at me hit weneþ, me looks like ine , the tail of the &yogh; in &yogh;if of the preceding line stand|ing directly over the first stroke of the m . Þise habbeþ forme þer-of A latin þat ham genieþ nota To depe; And ich schel seggen hit an englisch, Nou þer-of neme &yogh;e kepe.

Men of gode (ine) wil to ri&yogh;ti, ine written by a later hand in the margin, a little above ri&yogh;ti . And, wynne, Wanne hi wolde icristned be, And mo&yogh;e mid none ginne. mo&yogh;e , MS. more .

2.2: ¶ And be þou siker þat mannes lyf Is ri&yogh;t a kni&yogh;t-hod ine londe; And so seyþe iob, þe holy man. seyþe, y above the line. Now mote we þanne stonde mote , MS. wote . To fi&yogh;te : Þe feend, þat flesch, and eke þe wordle, Ageins ous beþ idi&yogh;te.

Þat he wiþ-stent hi alle, And hardeliche hert oþre men, A-doun þat hi ne falle, Ac stonde, So his ihert þor&yogh; conferming, In the margin, after conferming , is written in a later hand of gode . 2.19: ¶ Þys ylke sygne, and eke þys þyng, In oure child-hode we hyt toke; hyt , MS. &yogh;yt . Ac after-ward we lore þat þyng, Þo we to senne toke By wylle. Amend[e] we, þe prente lefþ Ine oure saule wel stille.
2.20: ¶ Hym selue no man hebbe schel To þe bischoppynge; Ine tokne of feblesce of hijs goste feblesce , MS. febleste . An oþer schel him brynge And lefte, Ase he ne mi&yogh;te nau&yogh;t hym self To confermynge crefte.
2.21: ¶ Ac her ich segge aperteliche, Þys men and eke þis wyues, Þat hi ne hebbe hare o&yogh;e child By hare quicke lyues, And rede; For &yogh;ef hy doþe, man and hys wyf Þer draweþ god-sibrede.
2.22: ¶ Of seue sacremens þre Prente ine herte makeþ; Þat beþ cristnyng, and confermyng, And ordre þat men takeþ Wel bliþe; Þat hijs, for no man hy ne takeþ MS. þat (hy) hijs (ne take) for no man hy ne takeþ, hy ne takeþ having been crossed out, and the words in parentheses added by a later hand over the line. Bote onelepy syþe.

3.1: NOu hy&yogh;t by-ualþ to telle &yogh;ou— And so ich mo&yogh;t wel nede— Of godes flesch and eke hys blode At cherche ine forme of brede And wyne; Þat freuereþ ous in oure exil, þat, t above the line. And lyþeþ oure pyne.
3.2: ¶ H&yogh;e bliþe my&yogh;ten hy be Þat folwede cryst in londe, Þat my&yogh;te hyne eche day yse, Hijs swete loue to fonde Ine keþþe! keþþe altered from keþe . So mowe we be, for ous neþ he neþ , MS. ner . Hy-faylled neuer seþþe. Hy-faylled = yfaylled .
3.3: ¶ For þo hijs tyme was ycome No leng to dwelle here, Þat wete brede and honde he toke, and honde = an honde . Þer he set atte sopere, And seyde: "Takeþ and eteþ, þys hijs my body"; Of soþe he ham aueyde.
3.4: ¶ For-wy hy&yogh;t moste nedes be Al soþe þat he sede; seþe , with indistinct e ; read soþe ? or seþe þat = since? Þat alle þyng his ase he seiþ Þy resoun wole þe rede. þy , MS. þys , the s being written over the line in a later hand. Lo dede: Lo , distinctly so in MS. (Wr. To ). He seyde to al þe worlde, "be," And al was ase he sede.
3.5: ¶ Nammore maystrye nys hi&yogh;t to hym To be ine bredes lyche, Þane hym was ine þe liche of man, To keþen ous hijs ryche; Þet makeþ Þat hy beþ alle mis-by-leued Þat oþer þrof for-sakeþ.
3.6: ¶ Þe fend hym-self him maky mey Wel dyuerse liknynges, Of best, of men, and of wymmen, nota And mani oþer þynges, To nusy: Wel bet may god to oure prou Dyuerse formes vsy.
3.7: ¶ Þo þat þe bred ytourned was In to hys body selue, selue , MS. sylue . He toke þe coppe wiþ þe wyne and water, Kölbing omits þe before wyne . I rather suspect that the words and water are a later addition. See note. And seide eft to þe twelue nota Yuere: "Takeþ and drynkeþ euerech on Of þis chalice here.
3.8: ¶ Þys hys þe chalis of my blode, þe chalis (Kölbing), MS. my chalis . Kölbing also proposes to read in (for of ) my blode , with reference to Luke xxii. 20. Of testament newe, newe , MS. nywe . Þat schal be schad for manye men"; And—ase we sey&yogh;eþ gode and trewe nota And kende— "And doþ &yogh;e þos, wanne &yogh;e hyt doþe, 543-545. See note. Doþ hyt in mine mende." mine , MS. &yogh;oure. &yogh;our is written in a later hand on erasure, only the final e is original. 3.10: ¶ And nou þat power hys y&yogh;iue nou and hys on erasure, the former very indistinct. Fram bysschoppe to preste, And so schel al so longe be, Ase cristyndom schel leste; Ymete, Seþþe crist four ous an orþe come, Seþþe , þþ on erasure. He nolde ous nau&yogh;t for-lete.
3.11: ¶ Þa&yogh; he were inne hys manhode þa&yogh; , &yogh; altered from some other letter, probably t . Amanges ous to flotie, &YOGH;et nere he nau&yogh;t þanne ous so ne&yogh;, Ase nou we mowe hym notye In vode: vode , MS. gode, g altered from original v . We honorieþ hyne al iholliche Ine flesch and eke ine blode. blode , a letter (probably u ) erased between o and d .
3.12: ¶ Wat may amounti þat he wyle So by-come oure fode? Chaungeþ he au&yogh;t, ase oþere mete, au&yogh;t , MS. nau&yogh;t, n over a in a later hand.— mete , MS. mote . In-to oure flesch and blode By kende? Nay, ac he chaungeþ ous in hym, To maky ous gode and hende.
3.13: ¶ And ase gode þer his hole mete, MS. hole men mete, men written above the line in a later hand. The original reading of the MS. seems to have been holen , and in l. 576 siken; the final n is erased, but some faint traces of it are still discernible in sike . For a possible emendation of the corrupt passage see note. And sike hyt by-swikeþ, So his þe mete dampnacion To hem þat senne likeþ To holde; holde [: solde ] = Kt. healde [: sealde ]. So he hyt tok and his lore, Iudas, þat ihesus solde. holde [: solde ] = Kt. healde [: sealde ].
3.14: ¶ Þer-fore ich segge a godes half To alle cristyne folke Þat, wanne hy scholle yhouseled be, Þat hy ne be a-bolke In prede; Let ounde and wreþe and coueytyng, Sleuþe and lestes on-lede.
3.15: ¶ Nys none of wymman beter ibore To seint Iohan þe baptyste; And &yogh;et he quakede wel ar&yogh; Þo he touchede crist Ine þe flomme: Þanne au&yogh;te we wel ary&yogh;t to be au&yogh;te , &yogh; above the line. To fange hym on-tromme.
3.16: ¶ Þer-fore, &yogh;ef þat &yogh;e fredeþ &yogh;ou Þat &yogh;e ne be nau&yogh;t digne &yogh;e , MS. he.—d in digne on erasure, apparently altered from s . For te be housled wyþ þys body Ine þissre holy signe, þissre , MS. þisþre . Wyþ-draweþ; For, wo þat hy&yogh;t takeþ ondygneliche, Hys iugement he gna&yogh;eþ.
3.17: ¶ May somman segge:—hou schal me so Fram þer houslyng dwelle? Wanne god self aperteliche Seiþ ous in þe gospelle— Wel mende:— MS. Wel to mende, to above the line in a later hand. "Who þat eteþ my flesch and drynkeþ my blod Heþ lyf wiþ-oute ende."
3.18: ¶ Þa&yogh; þou [ne] take hy&yogh;t wyþ þe mouþe, þa&yogh; , MS. þat . Ne myd teþ þer-on ne werche, Þou takest hyt, man, &yogh;ef þat þou art A lyme of holy cherche, To blysse, Wanne eny prest his messe syngeþ : Ilief hyt myd ywysse.
3.19: ¶ For on hys godes flesch to nemme Ase mouþe þe mete takeþ, An-oþer ase þe mete y&yogh;ete nota In-to þe membres takeþ; Ac here, Crist hys þat heued, þe prest þe mouþe, Þe lymes þat folke i-vere. i-vere, v in a later hand.
3.20: ¶ And ase þe bred to-gadere comþe Of menye greynys to bake, And ase þe wyne to-gadere flouþe nota Of manye grapes ytake, grapes , MS. greyns . Ilyke, Cryst and hijs membrys, men, O body beþe ine mystyke.
3.21: ¶ Wet hys mystyke ne mey non wete wete on erasure. After nō there is a half-blotted letter resembling b . Be no þynge a-founde, afounde = afonde , OE. āfondian . Bote wanne þer hys o þyng yked, An oþer to onder-stonde Þer-inne; Hy þat aredeþ þyse redeles Wercheþ by þilke gynne. þilke altered from þuke .
3.22: ¶ So wane þat body hym hys ked Of swete ihesu cryst[e], Me may wel onder-stonde þer By þulke selue lyste An oþer : Cryst and eke alle holy men O body, my leue broþer. MS. beþ O body, beþ written in the margin in a later hand.
3.23: ¶ Þer-fore god heþ þis sacrement god , MS. guod, u over o.—heþ , MS. beþ . Ymad of suiche þynges Þat my&yogh;te of manye mak on, As cryst and hys derlynges Imonge; Þenne scholde hy at one be In loue þat scholde hyt fonge.
3.24: ¶ Nou onderstand : þe signe her, Fourme hys of wyne and brede; Doble hys þat þyng, ry&yogh;t cristes body, Doble MS. (Wr. Noble ). And body of quike and dede. Ac broþer, &YOGH;et ry&yogh;te body þa&yogh; hyt be þyng, Read— þet þyng, ry&yogh;t body þa&yogh; hyt be ? See note. Hy&yogh;t hys signe of þat oþer.
3.25: ¶ Vor ase þe ry&yogh;te bodyes lemes Habbeþ dyuerse wyke, So habbeþ ry&yogh;t membrys eke Of þe body ine mystyke : Þat weldeþ Hys honden, men beþ þat wel doþ, Colon after honden in MS. Þe fet, þat wel op-heldeþ.
3.26: ¶ Alle takeþ þat ry&yogh;t body Þyse men at hare houslyng, Ac some to prou, and some to lere, Ine wyl of sene&yogh;ynge To derye; Ac one gode ary&yogh;t hyt nomeþ, Þat body ine hys mysterye.
3.27: ¶ Ac þa&yogh; we be tokned þer Ine oure sauueoure, Ne lef þou nau&yogh;t þe[t] we be þer, Ne forþe nau&yogh;t of oure Þat were; Þa&yogh; þer be tokned þynges two, Þer nys bote o þyng þere;
3.28: ¶ And þat hys swete ihesu cryst Ine flesche and eke ine bloude, Þat þolede pyne and passyoun, And diaþ opone þe roude, opone , MS. opene . Wel soure; Ne lef non oþer, crysteman, For safour ne coloure.
3.29: ¶ For þat colour, ne þat sauour, Ne beþ nau&yogh;t þer inne cryste, Þa&yogh; he þer-inne schewe hym By hys my&yogh;te-folle lyste, So couþe; Ne my&yogh;te elles bet be se&yogh;e, my&yogh;te = my&yogh;te he . Ne beter yured inne mouþe. yured . Over the u there is in the MS. a faint sign, which might be read as &yogh;.
3.30: ¶ For &yogh;ef he schewed hym in flesch, &yogh;ef, f in a later hand on erasure. Oþer ine blody þynge, Hydous hy&yogh;t were to þe sy&yogh;te, And to þe tast wlatynge tast , MS. cast . And pyne Þanne hys hyt betere in fourme of brede, And eke in forme of wyne.
3.31: ¶ For bred strengeþ þe herte of man, And wyn hys herte gledeþ; And strengþe longeþ þe body, longeþ þe body , read longeþ to þ. b .? And blice þe saule vedeþ: vedeþ or sedeþ , with a round s , is the reading of the MS., certainly not fedeþ as printed by Wright. And nede Þer-fore hys double sacrement, Of wyne, and eke of brede.
3.32: ¶ For he ybout heþ oure body, ybout, b altered from some other letter; after it a faint stroke, which cannot, however, be read as r . In-to os he let hys sinke; And uor þe saule ine þe blod, Hys blod he let os drynke. Nou woste The final e 's in woste and goste very indistinct. Wy þer hys double sacrement: For note of body and goste. The final e 's in woste and goste very indistinct.
3.33: ¶ Ac wen nau&yogh;t þat cryst be to-schift, Þa&yogh; he scheweþ ine boþe; To wene hys body wyþ-oute blod, By þa weye ne goþe To þryfte; For þer he hys, he hys al yhol, A dot is put in MS. after the first hys . Ne mey me hym to-schifte. me , MS. ine .
3.34: ¶ Þe&yogh; þer te-breke a&yogh;t ine þe mouþ, Oþer ine þyne honden, Hyt nas nau&yogh;t he þat hys to-broke; Ensample þou my&yogh;t fonden: To-slyfte A[l þy] myrour þou my&yogh;t fol wel, After A three letters erased, but traces of them are still visible; the first letter was probably l , the last certainly y . By the side of A , in the margin of the line, is written in , and in the margin of the following line þi selue se , all in a later hand and in smaller characters. See note. Bote nau&yogh;t þe ymage schifte. schifte , MS. schefte .
3.35: ¶ By þyse ensample þou my&yogh;t yse He hys ine ech autere MS. echautere . Y-hol; þe prest hys messe syngeþ, The MS. has a colon after Y-hol . Þe&yogh; he ne be nau&yogh;t yhere, Ac wykke, Ase þer beþ foles suiche fele, suiche, u altered to w in a later hand. Ysawe al to þykke.
3.36: ¶ Ac þa&yogh; þe prest hys messe do Inne dedleche senne corse, Þet sacrement, man, be þou syker, For hym nys na þe worse; na þe , MS. nase . For loke, Þe sacrement nys na þe wors, Þa&yogh; þat Iudas hyt toke.
3.37: ¶ Ac þa&yogh; hyt be neuer þe wors, Þat sacrement an honde, Þe bone þat swych prest þer by&yogh;t by&yogh;t = byt . No stel ne schel hym stonde, Ac derye; For he despyseþ ihesu cryst, Wanne he hym scholde herye.
3.38: ¶ Ac &yogh;yf þou wylt tak hyt to prou tak hyt for take hyt . For þe and þyne freende, Ry&yogh;t repentaunt and ry&yogh;t deuout Take hys deaþ in þy meende; Naut ly&yogh;t[e]: ly&yogh;t [ e ] = lyte . Þe more þou þenkest so on hys deaþ, Þe more hys þy meryte.
3.39: ¶ Manne, wanne þyt takest, ase oþer mete þyt = þe (for þou ) hyt . In-to þy wombe hy&yogh;t sedlyþ; Ac ne defiþ nau&yogh;t, ase þy mete Wyþ þyne flesch medlyþ, Ac keuereþ Al oþer wyse, and so þy body And þy saule hy&yogh;t freuereþ.
3.40: ¶ Nabyd hy&yogh;t nau&yogh;t, ase oþer mete, Hys tyme of defyynge, And ry&yogh;t anon hy&yogh;t freuereþ In þare oundervanginge; ounderv. or onnderv., but the n -stroke seems to be erased. Destresse Of syke men, þa&yogh; hy hyt keste op, Ne helpþ hyt nau&yogh;t þe lesse. lesse , MS. lasse .
3.41: ¶ For yf þe syke man hys gode In þe leue of holy cherche, Þe&yogh; he hy&yogh;t cast op, hyt bylefþ Sauuacion to werche Ry&yogh;t þere; For al at ones he mey be MS. he mey be god, god above the line in a later hand, evidently meant to gloss he , to which it is referred by the mark //. Þer and elles-were.
3.42: ¶ He soffreþ wel to be kest op, And &yogh;et to be honoured; Ac he soffreþ (no&yogh;t) to be to-trede, ( no&yogh;t ) above the line in a later hand. See note. And of bestes deuoured: And neade, Ase he by-leue assayþ in flesch, He assayþ ine forme of brede.
3.43: ¶ Þat body hy&yogh;t nys (na&yogh;t) þat þer comþe op, ( na&yogh;t ) above the line in a later hand.— nys, n on erasure, probably altered from original h . See note. &YOGH;ef þat a man hy&yogh;t keste; For al so longe hyt hys þat body, Ase forme of brede schel leste; Ine manne, &YOGH;et þa&yogh; þe fourme of brede to-go, Þat body by-lefþ &yogh;et þanne. &yogh;et , Wr. h&yogh;et , but the h is underdotted in MS.

For mende Of hys deþe and hys passyon, Ase he het atte hys ende. het , MS. heþ hit; þ in heþ on erasure, hit above the line in a later hand.
3.45: ¶ Of pure wete hyt mot be, And eke of pure wyne, Þet schel be to þys sacrement Ry&yogh;t of þe grape of wyne I-lete; For iesus seyþ þe vygne he hys, And eke þe greyn of wete.
3.46: ¶ And &yogh;ef mannes deuocioun slakeþ, Wanne he by-healdeþ— For hyt þinkþ bote oþer bred An hea&yogh; þat þe prest healdeþ— By-þenche hym Of þe uertue þat þer hys, Þat non errour adrenche hym; Some letter ( n ?) erased before the initial a in adrenche .
3.47: ¶ And tak en-saumple of þat he kneuþ, Þe preciouse stone: Þa&yogh; he lygge amang oþere ylyche, Me honoureþ hym alone; So swete Mid al þy wyl þer uertue hys, God self ine sacrement (ymete). The MS. has a dot after sacrement; ymete is a later addition. See note.
3.48: ¶ Na more ne greueþ hyt ihesus Þane sonne itrede in felþe; Þa&yogh; eny best deuoured hyt, Oþer eny oþer onselþe, Ech screade &YOGH;et al so longe hys godes body, Ase lest þe fourme of breade.

3.50: ¶ For water self nys nau&yogh;t þat blod, Ac hyt hys an-ylyke To þe folke þat torneþ al to cryst To þe folke , MS. Ine folke . Ine þe body of mystyke. Nou, broþer, I-lef al þys ine gode fey, For may no þyng be soþer.

7.44: ¶ And &yogh;yf þou hebbest so a child, Þe lawe y-wryte hyt sede, Þy wyf, þat his þyn o&yogh;e flesch, Dra&yogh;eþ eke þe godesybred[e], Y-mete, Þat hy ne may weddy þat child, .n. = nota : this and the others are later. .n. Ne fade[r] þet hyt bi&yogh;ete.
7.45: ¶ Þet ilke þat y-crystned hys Ne may weddy by la&yogh;e Him þat hym crystneþ, ne hys child, Ne wolde nase ua&yogh;e, wolde = wolde he . Ac lete, And eke hem þat hym hebbeþ so, nota [ later ] And alle hare bi&yogh;ete.
7.46: ¶ And forþe, fader and moder MS. for þe . Þat hyne fleschlyche forþ wyseþ Gostlyche for hym by-sebbe beþ To ham þat hine bapti&yogh;eþ; And heuen Þer-fore, þa&yogh; hy ham wedded eft, .n. Ne myt[e hy] so by-leuen.
7.47: ¶ And ase þe gossybrede dra&yogh;þ Ry&yogh;t to ous after crystnynge, So gossibrede dra&yogh;eþ ek Ry&yogh;t after confermynge By lawe, Þat so ne mo&yogh;e hy weddy nau&yogh;t, Ne wolde hy nase y-ua&yogh;e.
7.48: ¶ More godsibrede nys þer nau&yogh;t Þane hys y-mene&yogh;ed here, Godfader wedded godsones child Fol wel, my leue fere; .n. No senne Neþ man and wyf þat weddeþ ham, Godfader þe&yogh; he habbe enne. he = hy .
7.49: ¶ And &yogh;yf a man hebbeþ þy child, And nau&yogh;t bye þyne wyfe, Þy wyf may weddy þane man Wel after þyne lyue, .n. And libbe; And in þat cas þou my&yogh;t weddy To þyne wyfes gossibbe.
7.50: ¶ And [þa&yogh;] þat lawe for-bede nau&yogh;t for-bede , MS. for-bode . Þat man and wyf ymene Toe-hebbe a child, &yogh;et scholdy nau&yogh;t scholdy = scholde hy . Honestete so &yogh;wene, Ne wette Schrewede tonge for te speke, For sclaunder me schal lette.
7.51: ¶ Þe sibbe mowe to-gadere nau&yogh;t Þe foerþe grees wyþ-inne; Ne me ne scholde telle þe stok, scholde , MS. scholle . Ac after hym by-ginne Ac , MS. þat.—by-ginne , MS. bygenne; see note. To telle; And &yogh;ef oþer þe fifte of-takeþ, fifte , MS. fixte . To-gare mo&yogh;e hy dwelle. To-gare = to-gadere.—mo&yogh;e , MS. more:
7.52: ¶ &YOGH;ef þou myd word of þet hys novþe of , MS. if.—vþe in novþe in a later hand. Ary&yogh;t bi-treuþest one— Oþer þa&yogh; þet [þou] bi-treuþy hy nau&yogh;t— And hast flesches mone, By lawe Alle here sybbe affinite To þe for þan schel drawe.
7.53: ¶ And þet ine þe selue degre Þat hy beþ here by-sybbe; And &yogh;ef þou weddest eny of ham. In inceste scholle &yogh;e lybbe nota bene [ later ] An erþe, &YOGH;ef hy ysibbe ine degres Ry&yogh;t wyþ-inne þe ferþe.
7.54: ¶ And so drawyþ hy affinite Wyþ alle þyne sibbe, Wyþ , MS. Wyl . Ase þou of hire sibben dra&yogh;st For þan, þa&yogh; hy ne libbe; Wat deþ hy&yogh;t? deþ , MS. doþ . Hyt deþ þe Inonynge ine flesch, Inonynge , probably altered from noþynge; but see note. Þe&yogh; non ne wyte ne se hy&yogh;t. .n.
7.55: ¶ And holy cherche y-hote heþ, Me schal maky þe cryes At cherche oppe holy day&yogh;es þre By-fore þe poeple þryes, To assaye, To sech contrait &yogh;ef me mey Of destorber a-uaye. Of , MS. Ef .
7.56: ¶ For, erþe þe banes [be] y-gred, erþe = O.E. æ¯r þan . He þat þe treuþe makeþ Farþ ase he þat great work by-gunþ, And þanne conseil takeþ, And teyleþ; y in teyleþ hardly distinguishable from þ. Ac mani man þat so by-gunþ .n. Wyþ grete harme fayleþ.
7.57: ¶ And þa&yogh; þe weddyng were maked Ase hyt mytte by lawe, &YOGH;et hyt my&yogh;te eft be ondo, And eft al-so to-drawe. Wet wyse? &YOGH;ef þer ne mey noþere kendelyche þer ne over the line in a later hand; noþere altered from neuere . The original reading was probably— &yogh;ef me mey neuere kendelyche , etc. Do þe flesches seruyse.
7.58: ¶ Þet hys, &yogh;ef þat ere þe weddynge Folle þat ylke lette, Þat oþer were so ilet, To do þe flesches dette .n. By kende; For &yogh;ef þat lettyng velle seþe, Ne scholde hy nou&yogh;t to-wende.
7.59: ¶ And þa&yogh; þet on bi-wichched be Þanne hy to-gadere come, Þat hy ne my&yogh;te don ry&yogh;t nau&yogh;t, Ne a-sayde [hy] nase lome, .n. And wolde: &YOGH;et þre &yogh;ier hy abyde scholde, To-do ere hi be scholde.
7.60: ¶ And þa&yogh; þat seruyse be foul, &YOGH;et hyt hys tokne of gode; For hy&yogh;t by-tokneþ þe takyng Of oure flesch and blode nota [ later ] Ine cryst[e]: No stren may non encressy Read No stren ne may encressy nou? Wyþ-oute flesches loste. .n.
7.61: ¶ And dette hy&yogh;t hys in spousod, Wanne þe oþer hy&yogh;t wolde; wolde , MS. welde . For &yogh;yf hyt þoþer nolde do, hyt þoþer , MS. þyt oþer . Destrayned be he scholde .n. By rytte To do hyt, &yogh;yf þat he may: Þe lawe heþ seche my&yogh;te. seche (such), MS. þehe .
7.62: ¶ And þa&yogh; man habbe bysemer Of seche manere destresse, Be hem wel syker, hyt hys ydo For wel grete godnesse Of lyue; For elles nolde þe la&yogh;e nau&yogh;t þe added over the line by a later hand. Of suche þynge schryue.
7.63: ¶ In spoushod beþ godnesse þre, Treuþe, streny[n]g, and signe. A dot before strenyg and after it in MS. Treuþe hys, þat þer no gile be Þourwe spousebreche maligne; Ac, broþer, Þat on may spousbreche by-come .n. For de-faute of þet oþer.
7.64: ¶ Þat oþer godnesse hys strenyng, Þer me may children wene; Ac &yogh;yf þat on þoþren warneþ hys flesch, Dot before and after flesch . Ne my&yogh;t[e] hy naut strene: .n. On-nette Þo scholde þat godnesse be þo , MS. sþo (evidently meant for so ), the s added by a later hand. By-twene ham in lette. in lette , MS. inlette .
7.65: ¶ Þe þrydde godnesse hys sacrament, Þat hijs þe holy signe Of the ioynyng of god self And holye cherche digne, .n. Þat avayleþ; avayleþ: the original reading seems to have been fayleþ , which was corrected by a later hand to abayleþ , or, as I should read it, avayleþ . The metre requires vayleþ . And &yogh;yf [þon] þoþren warnþ hys flesch, Þat sacrement hem fayleþ.
7.66: ¶ By þyse þre hy mo&yogh;e ise Wanne hy ine flesche sene&yogh;eþ, Wanne hy wyþ-oute þyse þre Wyþ fleschlich mone me[n]geþ: .n. hare oþer, MS. hare oþer oþer , the first oþer above the line in a later hand. Þe more hy hyt doþ, þe wors hi beþ, hy hyt , MS. þyt; cf. 2024. And god al-so þe loþer.
7.67: ¶ Ase &yogh;ef hy hy&yogh;t my&yogh;te wel a-come To letten oþer wyle, And lesse do hyt þane hy doþ, Wyþ-oute oþeres peryl[e], .n. Ac blondeþ, And—nys nō ned—wyþ foule handlyng nō above the line. Oþer oþer afondeþ.
7.68: ¶ Ne hy ne wondeþ messeday, Ne none holy tyde, Ne holy stede, wyþ-oute peryl Þa&yogh; hy my&yogh;te abyde; .n. Spy, felþe! Þer hy my&yogh;te hyt do kendelyche, On-kende hys hare onselthe.
7.69: ¶ Hyt nys nau&yogh;t a&yogh;ens sacrement Of god and holy cherche, Þay hy nolde by goud purpos þay = þa&yogh;.—d in goud and r (above the line) in purpos in a later hand. Ine hare flesche werche, werche , MS. worche . By-feld; So ferde marye and ioseph, .n. By assent þat clene hem held.
7.70: ¶ For þey hye wolde [by assent] þey = þa&yogh; . The line is too short. I have added by assent (cp. ll. 2044, 2053), which yields the two wanting stress syllables. In flesch by-leue clene, &YOGH;et a&yogh;eyns treuþe nere hyt nou&yogh;t, Ne forþe a&yogh;eyns strene. Hou scholde hy&yogh;t A&yogh;e gode purpos of strene [be], .n. Bote oþer of ham wolde hy&yogh;t?
7.71: ¶ Ne hy&yogh;t nys a&yogh;eyns sacrement By assent þa&yogh; hy be clene In spoushoþ, &yogh;ef hy louieþ hem, louieþ , MS. leuies . And wel libbeþ imene; .n. Wytnesse Cryst and þys holy saulen eke, Al louieþ hem ine clannesse. louieþ , the u altered to w by a later hand.
7.72: ¶ And &yogh;yf boþe beþ of god wylle, And of assent at emne, To take to religion .n. And makye a vou solempne, a between makye and vou inserted by a later hand. Hy mytte In chastyte for euere mo Seruy oure drytte.
7.73: ¶ And &yogh;ef þat eyþer oþer may Kendelyche serue, Ne mo&yogh;en hy a&yogh;eins wyl to-go, Er þane oþer schal sterue; .n. No sauue, No sauue , read To saue? Bote &yogh;ef þat on for-houred be, He may de-partyng haue.
7.74: ¶ And &yogh;ef hy so departed be, Chastite he mote take, So longe ase þoþres lyf ylest Þat whas hys ry&yogh;t[e] make; whas = was . .n. Nyst gabbe, &YOGH;ef he oþer þane hy for-lyþ, A&yogh;en a schel hys habbe.
7.75: ¶ Þa&yogh; hy mysdede, &yogh;et, and he wyle, Eft a&yogh;eyn he may craue, Þa&yogh; þer such a departyng be, And hijs wyf a&yogh;eyn haue, And scholde; Þa&yogh; hy wyþ-seyde hyt openlyche, .n. And a&yogh;eyn come nolde.
7.76: ¶ Ac vnder-stond for þet hordom Þat makeþ þes to stryue, Þat eche hordom ne parteþ nau&yogh;t Þe man al fram hys wyf[e]. man , MS. mani or mam . .n. Nou lestne : &YOGH;ef þe oþer oþren so by-swykeþ, No mo&yogh;e hy nou&yogh;t onuestne.
7.77: ¶ Ne þa&yogh; a wyf by-gyled be Of an oþer by wrake, And weneþ wel to for-leye be .n. Of hyre ry&yogh;tte make; &YOGH;et more, Þa&yogh; hy be strengþe be for-leye, be , MS. ben . Takþ he nau&yogh;t houre lore. he = hy .
7.78: ¶ Ne &yogh;ef þon þoþer profreþ profreþ , MS. proofreþ ? for profereþ ? Wyþ any oþer to beddy; Ne &yogh;ef þon wenþ þis oþres deþ, Ne crossed out; the abbreviation for and written in the margin; e written over the o in þon; wenþ altered to welniþ (the l inserted, the i written over the line): all by a later hand. And he anoþer weddy: weddy (subj.), MS. weddeþ . Þa&yogh; come Þe make a&yogh;en, ne schelde hy be .n. To-do for hordome.
7.79: ¶ Ac &yogh;et, nou ounderstand for ham &yogh;et , MS. het . Þat gooþ a pylgrymage: On wēddeþ, þoþer abyde schel After On a letter erased; e over the o in þoþer, þer ( er abbreviated) on erasure in a later hand. See note. Wet oþer passeþ age .n. By kende, Oþer wat þat þer be of hys deaþ Ry&yogh;t god and certayn mende.
7.80: ¶ And &yogh;yf [þe] man halt ase hys wyf After þe gelt hys spouse, Þa&yogh; he by hyre ne ligge nou&yogh;t, notabile [ later ] Oþer halt hys ine hys house, In tome, Ne schal hy nau&yogh;t de-parted be Fram hym for hordome.
7.81: ¶ Þe signe hys of þe sacrement Þe treuþynge wel couþe, wel on erasure. Oþer couþe signe of þet asent, couþe , MS. cōþey . Wyþ worde [of] þat hijs nouþe; .n. And dygne Þynges þer beþ her mo þan on, Onder þys ylke signe.
7.82: ¶ Þet o þyng hys þet hol assent By-tuixte man an wyf[e], Wat byndi[n]g hys of þe spousehoþ, byndig for the most part on erasure, in a different hand. .n. To helde to ende of lyf[e]; And, broþer, Þys ilke þyng a signe hys eke Dot after þyng . Of þyng to-forin an-oþer. to fo in a later hand on erasure, only rin original, but the last stroke of the n half erased, and after it an erasure of one or two letters. Was the original reading perhaps þer-inne ?
7.83: ¶ And þat þyng hys, as ich seyde her, Þo ich her-an gan werche, werche , MS. worche . Þe holy ioynyng of godself .n. And of al holy cherche; In tome Of spou[s]hoþ þys aueyement aueye . ., second e over line. Loukeþ &yogh;ou for hordome. &yogh;ou written in the margin.— for , read fram ?

8.0: ÞO seynt Iohan in þe apokalips Se&yogh; priuetes of heuene, priuetes , MS. pruietes , the i -stroke put in the wrong place. He se&yogh; a bok was fast ischet Wyþ strong[e] lokes seuene; A wonder! Ne my&yogh;te hy no man ondo my&yogh;te , MS. my&yogh;ty (i. e. my&yogh;te hy ), hy written in the margin, in another hand. Aboue in heuene and onder.
8.1: ¶ And þo þat seint iohan y-se&yogh; þat, Wel sore he gan to wepe; Þo seyde an angel:—"wep þou nou&yogh;t, Ac take wel gode kepe: .n. Þys sygne Þat holy lambe þat sla&yogh;en hys To ondo hyt hys wel dygne."
8.2: ¶ Þys ylke bok þe mistyk ys Of þese sacrementis, Þat were ischet fram alle men, Wat god hymself out sent hys To tounne; For, be þou syker, hy were in god, .n. Er þan þe wordle by-gounne.
8.3: ¶ For ase he wyste wel [yno&yogh;] wel [ yno&yogh; ], cf. p. 150, l. 586. We scholde be by-gyled, So euer wyste he þat þe feend Scholde a&yogh;en be by-wyled Þor&yogh; cryste; Ac he hyt hadde wel priue For saternases lyste;
8.4: ¶ Al what os com þet ilke lambe, Ihesus, þat was y-slawe, Þat onne-schette þe queynte loken Þat spek of þe alde lawe, .n. And seuene So kedde out þyse sacremens, By-neþe and boue in heuene.
8.5: ¶ Þe ferste loke onleke ihesus, Ase he wel coude and my&yogh;te, Þo nychodemus to hym come notabile [ later ] At one tyme by ny&yogh;te, .n. To lerny, And he ondede hym cristendom: No leng he nolde hyt derny.
8.6: ¶ Þat lok [he] on-leak of confermyng Þer hijs apostles leye Slepynde, þo þat he ham bed he above the line in a later hand. Aryse for to preye Amonge, Þat hy ne uolle into fondyng, .n. Ac þat hye weren stronge.
8.7: ¶ Þe þrydde loke on-leke ihesus Þer he set atte sopere, Þo he sacrede hys flesch and blod, Ase ich &yogh;ou seyde hyt here, here = ere . So holde, In fourme of bred and eke of wyn, .n. Þat we hyt notye scholde.
8.8: ¶ And þo peter in ore ny&yogh;t ore , O.E. ā(n)re , MS. o&yogh;e . Þryes hedde hyne for-sake, And he by-held hyne þer a set, Ry&yogh;t atte hys pynyng stake, Nem kepe, Þer he on-leke penaunce loke, Þo peter gan to wepe. MS. vor to, vor over the line in a later hand.
8.9: ¶ Þe fyfte, þat hys Elyynge, fyfte , MS. fy&yogh;te . Cryst on-leke to oure wayne, Þo hand and fet and al hys lymes fet or fot in MS.? I-persed were ine payne .n. One-helede, One-helede , unhealed; the O looks almost like E in MS. For al þe sennes of oure lemes : Anon so be we anelede.
8.10: ¶ Þe syxte on-leke swete ihesus, Of ordre noþyng orne, Þo he a-ueng for oure loue Þe croune of scharpe þornes; notabile [ later ] Wel wyde Ondede þe lok of ry&yogh;t spousyng Þe wounde onder hys syde.
8.11: ¶ For ase wymman com of þe ryb Of þe mannes ry&yogh;t syde, So holyche[rche], spouse of god, Sprang of þane wonden wyde; nota [ later ] Nou leste Hou þat was hed conseyl ine god Sprounge hijs out at hys brest[e].
8.12: ¶ Nou, lord, þat coudest maky open Þet no man coude ounschette, And canste wel schetten þet hy[s] open, MS. þet hy be open, be over the line in a later hand. Þat none oþer can dette, can dette , MS. man derte . .n. To hopye So graunte ous þyne sacremens, Þat non errour ne (ous) a-scapye; MS. ous above the line in a later hand. See note.
8.13: ¶ And þat we hys mote aredy haue, Lord, her at oure nede, Þat no deue&yogh;l ne a-combry ous, Lord, þou hy&yogh;t ham for-bede .n. Amonge; And for þe tokene þat we neme, Lat ouse þy dole fonge. AMEN. holy written in the margin by a later hand, and marked for inser|tion before dole .

text.1: II. Pater noster. Domine labia mea aperies, Etc'. [ on leaf 182] ÞOu opene myne lyppen, Lord, Ps. l. 17. Let felþe of senne out-wende, out-wende in a later hand on erasure. And my mouþe, wyþ wel god accord g in god half erased. Schel þyne worschypyng sende. yng sende in a later hand on erasure. ¶ Deus, in adiutorium meum intende! [G]ode atende to my socour, Ps. lxix. 2. Lord, hy&yogh;e, and help me fy&yogh;te. Glorye to þe fader and sone, And to þe gost of my&yogh;tte; Ase hyt was ferst, and hijs, and schal and schal in MS. at the beginning of the next line. Euere more be wyþ ry&yogh;tte. 5-10. In the MS., as well as in Wright's edition, these lines are inserted in the wrong place, between ll. 26 and 27. [Hora matutina]. UAderis wyt of heue[ne] an he&yogh;, Soþnesse of oure dry&yogh;te, God and man y-take was y-take, y above the line. At matyn-tyde by ny&yogh;te. Þe disciples þat were his, Anone hy hyne for-soke; I-seld to gywes, and by-traid, To pyne hyne toke. Read hy hyne ? ADoramus te, christe, et benediscimus tibi, &c'. ¶ We þe honreþ, ihesu cryst, And blesseþ, ase þou os tou&yogh;test; For þour&yogh; þy crouche and passion Þys wordle þou for-bou&yogh;test. Oremus, Domine ihesu christe . We þe byddeþ, ihesu cryst, Godes sone alyue, Sete crouche, pyne and passyoun, MS. Sete on ( on over the line in a later hand) crouche; but cp. the Latin text. And þy deþe þat hys ryue, Between this and the following line the verses 5-10 above are inserted in the MS. By-tuext ous and iugement, Þat no fend ous ne schende, Nou, ne wanne þe tyme comþe Þet we scholle hennes wende; And &yogh;yf þe lyues mylse and grace, mylse , MS. mysse . Þe dede red and reste, MS. red and and . Holy cherche acord and pays, Ous glorye and lyf þat beste; Þat leuest and regnest wyþ þe fader Þer neuer nys no pyne, And also wyþ þe holy gost, Euere wyþ-oute fyne. AmeN. Ave maria gracia plena. dominus tecum. Benedicta tu, &c'. OSwete leuedy, wat þey was wo, þey = þe . Þo ihesus by-come morne, morne , MS. inorne . For drede þo þe blodes dropen Of swote of hym doun orne! And, leuedy, þe was wel wors, Þo þat þou se&yogh;e in dede Þy leue childe reulyche y-nome, And ase a þef forþe lede. y erased before lede . And ase he þolede þet for ous, Leuedy, wyþ-oute sake, Defende ous, wanne we dede beþe, Þat noe fende ous ne take. ¶ Pater noster. God, atente to my socour! Lord, hy&yogh;e, etc. [D]Eus in adiutorium meum. [p. 79] Domine ad. ¶ Hora prima. AT prime, ihesus was iled To-fore syre pylate, Þar wytnesses false and fele By-lowen hyne for hate. ¶ In þane nekke hy hene smyte, Bonden hys honden of my&yogh;tte, By-spet hym þat swe[t]e semblant MS. þat þat swe—e semblant . The wanting t in swete is owing to a hole in the parchment used by the scribe. Þat heuene and erþe a-ly&yogh;tte. ¶ ADoramus te christe . We þe honoureþ, &c'. domine ihesu christe . We þe biddeþ, ihesu cryst. Aue maria, &c'. OSwete leuedy, wat þe was wo Versicle. honoureþ , MS. hounureþ .— domine , MS. d ne , the small d being intended for the rubricator. A gode fry-dayes morwe, morwe , MS. morþe (or in orþe , as Wright). Þo al þe ny&yogh;t y-spende[d] was In swete ihesues sorwe! Þou se&yogh;e hyne hyder and þyder ycached, Fram pylate to herode; So me bete hys bare flesch, Þat hy&yogh;t arne alle a blode. And ase he þolede þat for ous, Leuedy, wiþ-oute crye, Scheld ous, wanne we deade beþ, Fram alle feenden mestrye. ¶ PAter noster. DEus in adiutorium. God, atende to my socour! [p. 79] Crucifige, &c'. [Hora tertia.] Crucyfige! crucifige! Gredden hy at ondre; A pourpre cloþ hi dede hym on, A scorne an hym to wondre; Hy to-stek hys swete hefed Wyþ one þornene coroune; Toe caluarye his crouche ha beer Wel reuliche ou&yogh;t of þe toune. ¶ V 7 . Adoramus te. Ue þe honoureþ, ihesu cryst, ut supra [p. 79]. Domine ihesu christe . We þe byddeþ, ihesu cryst [p. 80]. [A]ue maria, &c'. Oswete leuedy, wat þe was wo, Þo þat me ihesus demde, Þo þat me oppone hys swete body hys—swete separated in MS. by the hole in the parchment. So also se—mde , l. 82, which proves that the hole must have existed before the scribe wrote these lines. Þe heuye crouche semde! To bere hyt to caluary, I-wys, hyt was wel wery; For so to-bete and so to-boned, Hy&yogh;t was reweleche and drery. And alse he þolede þat for ous, Leuedy, a þysse wyse, I-scheld ous, wanne we dede beþ, From alle fendene Iewyse. ¶ DEus in adiutorium. Gode, atende to my socour. [p. 79] Pater noster. Hora sexta. On crouche y-nayled was ihesus Atte six&yogh;te tyde; Stronge þeues hengen hy On eyþer half hys syde; On in MS. at the end of the preceding line.— syde , MS. sede . Ine hys pyne hys stronge þerst Stanchede hy wyþ &yogh;alle, So þat godes holy lombe Of senne wesch ous alle. ¶ ADoramus te christe . We þe honoureþ, ihesu cryst [p. 79]. Oremus. Domine ihesu christe . We þe biddeþ ihesu cryst [p. 80]. Aue maria gratia plena. Oswete leuedy, wat þe was wo, Þo þy chyld was an-honge, Itached to þe harde tre Wyþ nayles gret and longe! Þe gywes gradden : "com a-doun!" Hy neste wat y mende, y = hy . For þran ha þole[de] to be do To deþ for man-kende. And ase he henge, leuedy, four ous A heye oppon þe helle, helle , MS. hulle . Ischeld ous, wane we deade ben, Þat we ne hongy in helle. Amen. ¶ Pater noster. Deus in adiutorium. God, atende to my socour [p. 79]. Lord, hy&yogh;e, &c'. Hora nona. Atte none ihesu cryst Þane harde deaþ felde; Ha grade "hely" to hys fader, Þe soule he gan op-&yogh;elde. A kni&yogh;t wyþ one scharpe spere Stang hyne iþe ry&yogh;t syde; Þerþe schok, þe sonne dym By-come in þare tyde. by-come in MS. at the end of the preceding line. ¶ Adoramus te. We þe honoureþ, ihesu cryst [p. 79]. Domine ihesu christe. We þe byddeþ, ihesu cryst [p. 80]. Aue maria gracia plena, &c'. Oswete leuedy, wat þe was wo, Þo ihesus deyde on rode! Þe crouche, and þe ground onder hym, By-bled was myd his blode. Þat swerde persed þyne saule þo, And so hyt dede wel ofter; Þat was þy sorwe for þy child : Deþe adde be wel softer. And ase he þoled þane deþ, Leuedy, for oure mende, Schulde ous, wanne we dede beþ, Fram deþ wyþ-outen ende. Amen. ¶ Pater noster. Deus in adiutorium. God, attende to my socour. Lorde hi&yogh;e, &c'. [p. 79] De cruce deponitur. hora, etc. [Hora vespertina.] Of þe crouche he was do At auesanges oure; auesanges , read euesanges ? = 'hora vespertina.' Þe strengþe lotede ine god Between strengþe and lotede there is in the MS. a mark of insertion, and in the right margin, after god, lefte is written by a later hand. Of oure sauueoure. Suche a deaþ a vnder-&yogh;ede, deaþ , a written over e . Of lyf þe medicine; Alas, hi was y-leyd adoun, Þe croune of blisse, in pyne. ¶ Adoramus te. We þe honoureþ, ihesu crist [p. 79 domine ihesu christe . We þe biddeþ, ihesu cry [p. 80]. Aue maria gratia plena. Oswete leuedy, wat þe was wo, Þo cryst was do of rode! For as a mesel þer he lay, A-stouned, in spote and blode. For-bere wepyng ne my&yogh;t hy Þat se&yogh;e al hou þou weptyst; Al hy þe se&yogh;e of hym blody, So ofte þou hine by-cleptyst. And ase he þolede þe fylþe For felþe of oure sennes, Helpe ous, leuedy, we clene be, Wanne we scholle wende hennes. AmeN ¶ Pater noster, &c'. Deus [in] adiutorium. God, attende to my socour, &c'. Lord hi&yogh;e, &c'. [p. 79] Hora complettorij. At complyn hyt was y-bore To þe beryynge, Þat noble corps of ihesu cryst, Hope of liues comynge. Wel richeleche hit was anoynt, Folfeld hys holy boke; Ich bydde, lord, þy passioun In myne mende loke. ¶ Adoramus te. We þe honoureþ, ihesu crist [p. 79]. Domine ihesu christe . We byddeþ, ihesu cryst [p. 80]. Aue maria, gracia plena, &c'. Oswete leuedy, wat þe was wo, And drery was þy mone, Þo þou sei&yogh;e þy lefe sone Ibered vnder þe stone! Þat þou wystest þour&yogh; þy fey þat , read þa&yogh; ?— fey , MS. feyþ , þ added by a later hand. Aryse þat he scholde, A drery fay hyt was to þe fay , MS. fayþ , þ in a later hand on erasure. Þat he lay vnder molde. And ase he was four ous y-bered, And aros þourwe hys my&yogh;tte, Help ous, leuedy, a domes day, Þat we aryse mytte brytte. Amen. In the right margin a later hand has added þe leuedy . ¶ Þyse oures of þe canoune, Lord, mene&yogh;e ich þe wel fayre, Wyþ wel gre&yogh;t deuocioun, A reyson de-bonayre. And ase þou þoledest, lor[d], for me Ope caluaryes doune, So, acordaunt to þy trauayl, Lord, graunte me þy coroune. AmeN.
text.2: (III.) De decem preceptis. ¶ ÞE man þat godes hestes halt, And þat myd gode wylle, And nau&yogh;t one by-fore men, Ac boþe loud and stylle, Meche hys þe mede þat hym worþe, By so þat he na-drylle; &YOGH;ef he hys brekeþ, and so by-leefþ, by-leefþ , MS. by loefþ? Hys sauyle schal he spylle. sauyle , MS. sauylle , first l underdotted. ¶ &YOGH;ef þou hys halst, man, god þe seiþe Ha wole be þe so kende, He wole be fo to þyne fon, And frend to þyne frende; Hye þe mysdoþ, ham wyle mysdo, Hye , read Hwo? And haue þys in þyne mende : Hys angel schal to-for þe go To wyte þe fram þe fende. ¶ Þyne sustenaunce þou schel[t] haue, Þy&yogh; nau&yogh;t a lyue delyce, Ac mete and cloþes renableliche, And lyf ine herte blysce. Þa&yogh; folk þe heelde a nice man, MS. anice . Þer-fore nert þou nau&yogh;t nyce; I-likned worþ þy gode loos So swete so þe spyce. ¶ &YOGH;ef þe þat art a crystene man Wel hy healde by-falleþ, Syker þou my&yogh;t be of þat lond Þar melke and hony walleþ; Þat hys þe blysse of heuene a-boue, Þar holy soulen stalleþ Ine glorye þer none ende nys, Ne none swetnesse a-ppalleþ. ¶ To wyte þanne wat god ha&yogh;t Is eche man wel y-halde; Þrof ich may telle ase ich wot, Ase oþer men me tealde, And ase hyt hys in holye boke I-wryten ine many a felde : Lestneþ to mey, par charyte, mey = me . Boþe &yogh;onge and ealde. ealde , the a altered by a later hand from o , which was written on erasure; an e before it is still clearly distinguishable. ¶ O þyng hyt hys, al þat god hat, Bote a two he hy&yogh;t dy&yogh;te, And þat hys loue, man, syker þou be, To louye wyþ þy my&yogh;te. my&yogh;te , MS. my&yogh;t , with a flourish to the t . Þou ert y-helde, man, þer-to By skele and eke by ry&yogh;tte; Þou þenke her-on, par charyte, By dayes and eke by ny&yogh;tte. ¶ Þys loue god heþ y-di&yogh;t a tuo Amang hijs hestes alle. Þe ferste hys, for to louye god, By-falle what so falle; Seþþe to louye alle men, So broþren scholde ine halle, Wyþ-outen byternesse of mode, Þat hijs þare saule galle. ¶ Þe man þat healdeþ þys[e] two, Of charyte þe heastes, Al he folue[l]þ þe lawe of gode, And prophetene gestes. Ac lasse loue þer hys wyþ men Þane be wyþ wylde bestes : Þat doþ þat manye y-schodred ben y-schodred, r written over e ; see note. Fram heuene-ryche festes. ¶ Ten hestes haueþ y-hote god, Ase holy wryt ous tealde; Ope two tablettes of ston Wyþ hys finger bealde He hys wrot, Moyses by-tok, Kölbing supplies and before Moyses . Wylom by da&yogh;es ealde, To wyse man hou [he] schal wel [ he ] supplied by Kölbing. Þese ten hestes healde. ¶ In ston ich wot þat he hys wrot, wot , small r written over o in MS. In tokne of sykernesse, Þat wo þat wole ysaued be, wo = who , MS. we , originally wey , the y afterwards erased. Þe more and eke þe lesse, By-houeþ þat he healde hy Wyþ al hys bysynysse. Allas! feawe þencheþ þer-on I[n hare] wykkednesse. I[n hare ], MS. I a ; between them there is a blank covering some five or six letters. ¶ Þet o table hedde þry Of þyse hestes tene; Þe þri longeþ to loue of gode, Ase hy&yogh;t schel wel be sene. Þe seuen longet to loue of man, Þat none scholde wene none , read non ne? Ine þoþer table sete þo, To-gadere and al y-mene. ¶ Honury þou schelt enne god, Hym one to by-knowe; Take nau&yogh;t hys name in ydelschepe, Wyþ ydel wynde to blowe; Hal&yogh;e þou þe masseday, Ase he comþe in þe rewe: In þese þre schewyþ þe loue of god, schewyþ . . god: MS. þe loue of god schewy hit: hit , as well as to in l. 96, above the line in a later hand. But see note. Were hyt hys to sewe. ¶ Worschipe þy fader and moder eke; Ne bryng no man of lyue; Do þe to none lecherye, Þa&yogh; þe fondyngge dryue; Wytnesse uals ne bere þou non; Of þefþe þou ne schryue; Coueyte none mannes wyf, Ne nau&yogh;t of hys forstryue. ¶ Þys beþe þe seuene þat loue of man Schewe[þ] what hy&yogh;t be scholde; &YOGH;ef eny man fayleþ eny of þys, Nys hy&yogh;t bote an on-holde. Ac al to fewe louyeþ ham, And wylleþ þat oþer wolde; Alas! wat schal be hare red Wanne hy beþ vnder molde? ¶ Ac many man desceyued hys, And weneþ þat he hys helde; And weyneþ þat he be out of peryl, Oþer ine senne so schealde, Þat hym ne douteþ of no breche Of godes hestes healde; Ac he not nefer wat hy beeþ, Ne neuer hy ne tealde. ¶ I-wryte hyt hys, ich telle hy&yogh;t þe, Ine þe boke of wysdome, Þat eche man scholde conne hy, And rekeny wel y-lome; And þat hy nere nau&yogh;t for-&yogh;ete, Wane oþere þou&yogh;tes come, Tys fyngres scolde man bynde hy Tys = to [te] hys; cp. p. 33, l. 915; also þyt , l. 132 = þou [þe] hyt . For doute of harde dome. ¶ For mannes honden and hys fet Beret tokene wel gode Of alle þe tenne comaundemens: Þat, man, þyt onder-stoude! onder-stoude, ou written for ō ; so also in for-broude , l. 136. Ten fyngres and ten þine tone, Of flesche and bon and blode, Tokneþ þat þyne workes ne be, A&yogh;eyns þe hestes, for-broude. ¶ &YOGH;et somman hijs þat passioun-lyche passioun-lyche , read passing-lyche ? Can telle hy myd þe beste, Ac ine hys dedes uares he Ase he nau&yogh;t of hem neste; And &yogh;et hym þingþ þat he deþ wel, And for to come to reste; Ac al desceyued schel he be, Wanne comeþ þe grete enqueste. ¶ Here-fore nys hy&yogh;t nau&yogh;t y-nou&yogh; To telle hy uor to conne: MS. ne (over the line in a later hand) uor to conne . And telle and werche wel þer-by, Þanne hys hy&yogh;t alle y-wonne. For wel to conne, and nau&yogh;[t] to don, to don , MS. no don . Nys naþer rawe ne y-sponne; Lytel hijs worþ, bote hyt endy wel, dy in endy on erasure; wel in MS. at the beginning of the next line, with a dot after it. Þyng þat hijs wel by-gonne. ¶ Þey hyt be wel lyttelyche ysed, lyttelyche for ly&yogh;telyche . Þe ferste heste a rowe, For to honoury anne god, Hym one to by-knowe, Þenche þou most wel bysyly, And þy wy&yogh;t þran by-stowe, And bydde hym, þat þou hyt mote do, Wel myldeleche a knowe. ¶ For þou ne my&yogh;t hytte nefere do, Man, wel wyþ-oute grace: So heþ þys wordle bounde þe Wyþ here lykynges lace. lace , MS. lause, u and s on erasure in a later hand. Þer-fore þe by-houeþ godes helpe, Þat he hyt wolde arace, So þat þou ne teldest no worþ Of [here] blandynge face. ¶ For &yogh;yf þy wyl reio[ye]þ more reioyeþ , MS. re i oþ . In enyes kennes þynges, Be hy&yogh;t þy childe, oþer þy best, þy (Kölbing), MS. þe . Land, brouches, oþer rynges, rynges , MS. ryngeþ . Oþer a&yogh;t elles, wat so hyt be, Bote god þat hys kynge of kynges, MS. Bote yne god, yne added by a later hand above the line.— heuene (underdotted) after of . Þou ne a-nourest god ary&yogh;t, In the margin, above ary&yogh;t , a later hand has written na&yogh;t , to be inserted after anourest . Ac dest is onderlynges. ¶ By-lef þou in no wychecraft, Ne ine none teliinge, Ne forþe inne none ymage self, Þa&yogh; þat be great botninge; Bote as al holy cherche þe tek[þ] Þou make þyne worþynge, For gode nele nau&yogh;t þat þou hyt do, Bote by þere wyssynge. ¶ Þanne asay þyn o&yogh;e þo&yogh;t By þysser ylke speche, And &yogh;yf þou annourest god ary&yogh;t, Þyne inwit wyle þe teche; And &yogh;yf þou fynst þat þou ne dest, Amende, ich þe by-seche: Þou ert a sot, and my&yogh;t do bet, And so si&yogh;st yn þe smeche. ¶ Þat oþer heste apertelyche Schewed mannes de-faute, schewed = scheweþ . Wanne he alday swereþ ydelleche In kebbyng and in caute. Mechel hys þat he makeþ hym Her-efterward to touty, Wenne he schal hys a-countes &yogh;yue Of ech idel sente. 196-200. See note. ¶ Þenne ne couþe ich nanne red Of þylke a-countes oure, Nere þe milse of god self, After milse , a later hand has added above the line & merci . Oure alder auditour[e], Þat wolle þe arerages for-&yogh;eue, &YOGH;ef hyt hys to hys honoure; Ac cesse, man, of þy ydelschep, Oþer ich wole out wel soure. ¶ þrydde heste apertelyche Scheweþ þy wykked rote, þy , MS. wyþ . Wanne þou [ne] halst þy masseday, As god hyt haþ y-hote, Ac werkest, oþer werky dest, werky, y altered from e . Werkes þat beþ to note: Þe wykkede ensaumple þat þou &yogh;efst Þou a-beyst, ich þe by-hote. ¶ And þa&yogh; þou ne werche nau&yogh;t, þa&yogh; (Kölbing), MS. þat ; we may as well read [ þa&yogh;] þat . Ac gest to þyne gloutynge, þyne (suggested by Kölbing), MS. þyne ; but see note. Oþer in eny oþer folke See note. In pleye of þretynge, See note. Þou halst wel wors þane masseday Þane man myd hys workynge; Þare-fore do þe al y-holliche do (Kölbing), MS. to . Þat day to holy þynge. ¶ Þe ferþe heste scheweþ þe ferþe , MS. feste or fefte . Þat þye senne schal sle þe, sle þe , MS. sleþe . &YOGH;yf þou rewardest þyne eldrynges nau&yogh;t A lyue and eke a deþe, Þat were wel besy to brynge þe forþe, As hy my&yogh;ten onneþe; onneþe , MS. onnyþe . &YOGH;yf þou hy gna&yogh;st and flag&yogh;st ek, Ry&yogh;t hys þat fendes flea þe. flca þe , MS. fleaþe . ¶ Nau&yogh;t nys þys heste y-hote of god For suche eldren al-lone, Ac hys of mannes eldren eke As he te&yogh;t atte font-stone, Þer holy cherche þy moder hys In fader cristes mone; MS. And fader in cristes mone; see note. &YOGH;ef þou ert on-boxom to hyre, Grace of God ne worþe þe none. ¶ Þe fyfte heste scheweþ þe Þat þou ne schalt nau&yogh;t smyte, Ne nau&yogh;t ne mys-segge ne mys-do, Ne nau&yogh;t foulleche at-wyte. foulleche , MS. foules he . For ofte þe mannes sle&yogh;te aryst, Were man hy&yogh;t weneþ wel lyte; lyte , MS. lytel . And he þat spilleþ mannes lyf, Veniounse hyt schel a[c]wyte. a [ c ] wyte (Kölbing). ¶ And &yogh;ef þer hys mansle&yogh;þe pur, &yogh;ef , read &yogh;et?—mansle&yogh;þe , MS. sle&yogh; þe . As ous telleþ holy boke, &YOGH;yf eny man for de-faute deyþ, And eny hym for-soke To helpe hym of þat he may, Hys lyf to saue and loke: Her dere &yogh;er acuseþ fele Þat god and orþe touke. ¶ And &yogh;et seint iohan þe-wangelyst Al into mende dra&yogh;eþ, He þat hatyeþ eny man, He seche þat he hym sla&yogh;e. See note. Manye suche mansle&yogh;þen beþ, mansle&yogh;þen: MS. - sle&yogh; þen . Þat al day men for-gna&yogh;eþ, & Sweche beþ in helle depe, w in Sweche over the line, in the original hand-writing, it seems. Þat deuelen al to-draweþ. ¶ Þe sixte heste scheweþ wel Þe soþe to al mankenne, Þe dede ydo in lechery Hys ry&yogh;t a dedleche senne; And elles nere hy&yogh;t nau&yogh;t for-bode for-bode begins next line in MS. amange þe hestes tenne : Þe þat seggeþ hyt nys nau&yogh;t so, so in MS. transposed to the following line. hare wy&yogh;t hys al to þenne. ¶ Her hys for-bode glotenye, So ich þe by-hote; For hyt norysseþ lecherye, hyt , MS. ich . After lecherye an underdotted a is written in MS Ase fer, þe brondes hote. And þa&yogh; þer be alone lomprynge In lecheryes rote, Al hyt destrueþ charyte, Wyþ wrake and wyþ þrete. ¶ Þe seuende heste schewed wel Man schal be true in dede, Þat no man abbe of þe oþeres naut þrete ? distinctly so in MS. Þor&yogh; þefte wycke rede; For al hys þefte þat man te&yogh;t abbe , read nabbe ? (Kölbing). Myd wyl of wynnynghede wynnynghede ? MS. wymynghede . A&yogh;ens þe ry&yogh;t o&yogh;eres wyl, So lawe y-wryte hyt sede. ¶ Þanne hys hyt a þef, wo-so hyt be, Þat manne god so takeþ, Be hy&yogh;t by gyle oþer mestry, Oþer wordes þat he crakeþ. In londe suche his many a þef Þat y-now hym makeþ; He wenþ by chere of iugement, chere , read schere ( skere )? See p. 105, l. 183. Ac helle after hym wakeþ. ¶ Þe e&yogh;tende heste þe for-bed Þe false wytnessynge; And þat hys, man, syker þou be, Alle manere lesynge To hermy in [hys] body man, Oþer in hys oþer þynge, Oþer in hys saule, and þat hys worst, Kölbing suggests leaving out in . In peryl for to brynge. ¶ Al hyt hys senne þat me le&yogh;þ, Bote þat men le&yogh;þ for gode Ry&yogh;t deadlyche senne nys þat nau&yogh;t, For myldenesse of mode. Ac elles, man, al þat þou legst Is deaþlich and for-brode; Þo þet hy&yogh;t useþ, ich wot hy beþ Vn-wyser þane þe wode. ¶ Alas! onneþe eny man Þat þyse heste(s) healde; Alle hy beþ y-torned to lesynge, Þes &yogh;onge and eke þes ealde. ealde , MS. olde . Þer-to hys mentenaunce great, Þat makeþ hy wel bealde : Do &yogh;e nau&yogh;t so, par charyte, Ac &yogh;oure tongen &yogh;e wealde. ¶ Þe ne&yogh;ende heste þe for-bed Þat wyl to lecherye, And to spousbreche nameleche, Þat so meche hys to glye. Þanne nys hyt nau&yogh;t one dea[d]lyche Swych dede to complye, Ac ys þat uoule wyl al so To swyche fylenye. ¶ Þe teþe heste þe fo[r]-bet Wyl tou oþer manne þynge, tou = to . For þat desturbet charyte, In onde man to brynge. Defendeþ &yogh;ou for godes loue Fram alle wykked wyllynge; For suche wyl hys for dede iset In godes knelechynge. ¶ Nou ich &yogh;ou bydde for þe blode Þat ihesus blede on þe rode, Þat in te herte takeþ þys two Omit two ? text.3: IV. [De septem mortalibus peccatis.] SEnne makeþ many þral, Þat scholde be wel fry; And senne makeþ many fal, &YOGH;at he ne mote iþy. Al þat hys boue and vnder molde, Hou my&yogh;t hyt bote hyt bowe scholde To hyre owene mede? Wanne he þat al þys wordle schel welde To hyre worschipe hys yhelde For here moder-hede. Al þyse maydenes, wyþ-out bost, Hy bereþ god in here goste, In hare holy þou&yogh;t[e]; Ac hy wyþ-oute mannes ymone In body, and nau&yogh;t in gost a-lone, alone , MS. aboue (Wr. corr.). To manne hyne broute. Of hyre þat hys þos dygne of take, of take , read op-take , assumpta? Mätzner writes of lake (O.E. lāc , gift, offering). Hou my&yogh;te ich of hyre songes make, Þat am so foul of lyue? And þou me bede, soster, synge, And , read Ac ? (Kölbing's conjecture). And alle in-to one songe brynge Here swete ioyen fyue. To segge þat ich hyt maky can, Þat am so one-connende a man, Dar ich me nau&yogh;t auanty; Ac tryste ich wolle to oure leuedy, And maky hyt ase hyt wyle by, And ase hy hy[t] wole me granty. hy hy [ t ], MS. hy hy; Mätzner omits one hy.—wole , distinctly so in MS.; Wr. wolde . As man ine hys by-leaue yseþ, Ioyen of hyre so fele þer beþ, Ne may hys no man telle, hys (not hyt ) in MS. Ase hy haþ of hyre leue sone: Hyt passeþ al mankendes wone, And out of mannes spelle. Four manere ioyen hy hedde here Of hyre sone so lef an dere, Wytnes opan þe godspelle; And al[le] comeþ of þe blysse of þe , MS. ofte þe (Mätzner corr.). Þat hye heþ nou, wyþ-oute mysse, So stremes of þe welle. Þe wylle þat hys in paradys Fol wel by-tokneþ þys auys, Wyþ here stremes foure, Þet orneþ out ouer al þat londe, Nys neuer erþlyche man þat fond Nys , read Nes ? Hou fele come of þe stoure. Þys wulle hys god self man by-come, Of hym þys ioyen beþ alle y-nome, And alle ine uour manere: uour , MS. nout , Mätzner noue = new; but cp. l. 49. Þe furste was wyþ concepcioun, Þo þe angel gabryel come a-doun Ine stede of messager[e], To brynge þe tyþynge by-fore Þat cryst of hyre wolde by bore, Mannes trespas to &yogh;elde, For to brynge ous out of helle: Wo mytte þenche oþer telle An o has been cancelled after mytte . Wat ioye þer y uelde! In na&yogh;areth, þe ryche toun, Aue maria was þat soun Of gabrieles steuene; Þo was þat mayde wel ygret, wel is the reading of the MS.; Wr. was . And wyþ a present wel ageet wel ageet , Mätzner weleget (for weleged ), enriched; see note. Fram vader oure of heuene. So he was ine hyre ycome, For fleasch and blod of hyre to nome, Ase þe angel hyre seyde; Ne hy of mannes mone neste, Ne hy ne brek nau&yogh;t hyre by-heste, Ac euere clene a mayde. Ac , read As ? Seynt johan þe baptyst on-bore, Þo hy spek hys moder by-fore, Ine ioye he gan to asprynge. Ely&yogh;abet wel þat aspyde, Hou a spylede onder hyre syde, hyre , MS. hys (Mätzner corr.). And made hys reioyynge. More encheyson hadde oure leuedy Ioyous and blyþe for to by, by , MS. be . Wyþ-oute prede and boste; For in hyre selue hy hyne fredde, Fol wel hy wyste hou [hy] hyne hedde [ hy ] inserted by Mätzner. Þor&yogh; self þe holy goste. Ioseph kedde þat he was mylde, Þo þat he wyste hy was wyþ chylde, A-wey he wolde alone; Ha nolde nau&yogh;t he were a-slawe, he = hy; so, too, l. 111. Ne forþe y-iuged by þe lawe To by stend wyþ stone. Ac ioseph was wel blyþe, aply&yogh;t, Þo to hym cam þe angel bry&yogh;t, Þo , MS. So . To segge hym wat he scholde; Wel blyþþere my&yogh;te be þat may, Þat was y-conforted al day Wyþ aungeles wanne hy wolde. In þyssere ioye we scholde by-louken Al hyre ioyen of uourti woken Þe wylest he &yogh;ede wyþ chylde. Of hyre [barme] hyt was god game, See note. Þer-inne þet vnicorn weks tame Þat er þan was so wylde. þan , MS. þang . Þet oþer ioye of hyre ycore Was of ihesus, of hyre ybore A crystemasse ny&yogh;te, Wyþ-oute sor&yogh;e, wyþ-oute sore; And so ne schal þer neuer more Wymman wyþ childe dy&yogh;te. dy&yogh;te , Mätzner proposes be dy&yogh;te . Perhaps we ought to read hyt dy&yogh;te . For so hy hyne scholde ferst auonge, Þer nes no senne þer amonge, nes (Mätzner nas ), MS. nys . Ne noe flesches lykynge; Þer-fore of hyre y-bore he was, Ase þe sonne passe&yogh;t þor&yogh; þe glas Wyþ-outen on openynge. Omission of on proposed by Mätzner. In suaþebendes hy hyne dy&yogh;te, Ase hyt hys þe chyldes ry&yogh;te, And &yogh;ef hym melk to souke; Þa&yogh; hyt were þustre of ny&yogh;t, Þer nas wane of no ly&yogh;t, Þe heuene gan onlouke. Out com an aungel wyþ great leem leem , second e , being written close to the m , looks like o in MS. In-to þe feld of bedleem, Amonges þe schepherden, schep- , MS. schop ? Te telle þat cryst was ybore; Þer come singinde þer-fore Of angeles manye verden. Þanne sede he swyþe wel Gracia plena , gabryel, And þat hys "fol of grace"; Wanne glorye of hyre hys fol a-boue, And pays igrad for hyre loue Of angeles in place. Þe oxe and asse in hare manyour, Þo þat hy se&yogh;en hare creatour creatour , MS. creature . Lyggynde in hare forage, Al one-knowynge þa&yogh; hy were, Hy makede ioye in hare manere, And eke in hare langage. Ope þe he&yogh;e e&yogh;tynde day He onder-&yogh;ede þe gywen lay, And was ycircumcysed. Iesus me clepede hyne þer-uore, Ase aungeles, er he were ybore, Hys eldren hadde y-wysed. Mochele ioye hy aspyde, Þe kynges þre þat come ryde Fram be easte wel iverre; Wr. i-verre , MS. werre (distinctly). Gold, myrre, stor, were here offrynges, Þat he was lord and kyng of kynges Wel by-toknede þe sterre. Þo þat he scholde y-offred by by , MS. be . In þe templo domini , templo , so MS. Ase la&yogh;e &yogh;ef þe termes, Symeon, þe olde man, gan crye, And spek of hym fur prophecye, fur = for (Mätzner); or ought we to read þor&yogh; (also spelt þour&yogh; )? And tok hym ine hys earmes. Þo he was bote twelf wynter ald, he , MS. &yogh;e . And he&yogh; ine þe temple he seat wel bald, And (= An ) he&yogh; , MS. he&yogh; he , but the he has been cancelled. And þa&yogh; he speke smale, Many man wondrede on hym þere, For to alle clerkes þat þer were He &yogh;af answere and tale. Alyue uertu was hys childe-hode, Alyue , read Al yne ? cp. p. 123, l. 253, Al ine ioye was hyre mende.—chylde-hode , MS. - hoþe , the þ not quite distinct. And so he com to hys manhode; Ine flom iordanes syche He was ycrystned, þe heuene onleake, Þe fader of heuene doun to hym spake, Þe gost com coluere ylyche. To þyssere ioye longye scholle Alle þe ioyen þat hyre folle Of hyre chylde god, Read Of hyre chyld þe gode ? cp. p. 126, l. 348, iesus þe gode . Fram þan tyme he was ybore For al mankende þat was for-lore, For[t] he deyde one þe roude. Fort , until (Mätzner), MS. For . ÞE þrydde ioye þat com of cryste Hadde oure leuedy of hys opryste Fram deaþes harde bende, Out of þe sepulcre þer he laye, Ase hyt fel þane þrydde daye After hys lyues ende. Wet ioye of hym my&yogh;te be more After suiche sor&yogh;ynge and swyche sore, Ase hye yseye hine feye, Þanne isi&yogh;e hyne come to lyue a&yogh;en, And euereft more alyue to ben, Omit And ? And neuere eft to dey&yogh;e? Þat he was lyf and strengþe and my&yogh;te, And þat he kedde on Estre ny&yogh;tte, Al ine þe dawyynge : Al þa[t] was an erthe schok, And heuene aboue vnder-toke Hys holy vppe-rysynge. Þar doun come aungeles whyte ine wede, And þat he was aryse hy sede, And hare sawe was trewe; Þat he ne laye nau&yogh;t vnder molde For to a-saye, ho so wolde, Þane stone hye ouer-þrewe. Þa&yogh; þat he ine hys manhoþ deyde, Dominus tecum þat a seyde, Þo þe aungel here by-redde, (Þat hys to seggene "god es my&yogh;tte"), MS. godes my&yogh;tte; my&yogh;tte = mytte, myd þe . Ine ry&yogh;te soþe hyt moste sitte sitte; Mätzner fitte , i. e. fi&yogh;te , fight. Þet god-hoþ wel hyt kedde. Nedde oure leuedy þyse blysse a-lone, Ac al hyre frendes in hyre mone, So meche was here þe more; For more hijs blysse god and clene Among frendes to habbe ymene, After sor&yogh;ynge and sore. O þat hy were blyþe, þo hye (here) se&yogh;en here MS.; Wr. were (omitted by Mätzner).— se&yogh;en , MS. si&yogh;en . So glorious alyue, wyþ here e&yogh;en, Þet hy yseye er ine paygne! Furste a schewed hym wyþ a fayre chaunce To here þet hys ensample of repentaunce, Marye magdaleyne. And so hyseye hyne peter, and seþenes hy alle, hyseye = yseye = yse&yogh; , saw; MS. hygeye , Mätzner hygede , hied.— seþenes , first e resembling o; Wr. sothenes , Mätzner sothes . And þer thomas of ynde, a k[n]owes yfalle, k [ n ] owes , corrected by Mätzner. Groped hys holy wounde; Groped , MS. Croped; cp. l. 240. Þare he fond flesch and blod myd þe bones, An nou he gan to crye loude for þe nones: "My lord ich abbe y-founde." Houre lord hym answerde in þet cas: "Þou leuedest, for þou se&yogh;e me, thomas, Þat þou me haddest y-founde; Ac, thomas, ich þe telle, yblessed hy beþ, Þo þat on me by-leueþ and nau&yogh;t me seþ, Ne gropyeþ none wounde." To þyssere ioyen scholle by yleyd Alle þe ioyen þat mo&yogh;e be yseyd, Ine wyttes oþer in mende, Fram crystes resurreccioun, Wat comeþ hys ascensioun At fourty da&yogh;en ende. da&yogh;en , MS. sa&yogh;en (Wr. corr.). ÞE ferþe ioye telle ich may, Þe ferþe in MS. Þat fel opon þe holy þoresday, Opone a mounteyne he&yogh;e; mounteyne , MS. mounte yne . Hi se&yogh; ihesus, and oþre some, Hi (not he ) in MS. Of flesch and blod of hyre ynome, Op in-to heuene ste&yogh;e. Al ine ioye was hyre mende, Þo hy se&yogh;e here and oure kende, Þo , MS. So . Ihesus, hyre leue sone, In-to þe blysse of heuene sty, To agredy worþy scholde hy be See note. At hyre assumpcioun[e]. And &yogh;et ne were hyt no&yogh;t y-no&yogh; One to agredy hyre loo&yogh; And he&yogh; ine heuene blysse, And (= an ) he&yogh; . Ac oure also, hyt nis non oþer, For he hys oure kende broþer, Þat leue we to wysse. Ine hym ne schal hyt nau&yogh;t lang be schal , MS. schalt (Mätzner corr.). Þat we to hym ne scholle te, Wanne we scholle wende hennes; Ac schel on ous, þat beþ onkende, Ne dra&yogh;eþ nau&yogh;t hys loue to mende, And wreþeþ hyne wyþ sennes. And &yogh;et he hys milde and sparyeþ some, And ase he wente op, he wole come A domesday wel bry&yogh;te, For te trye manne dede, trye , MS. crye . And after dede &yogh;iue mede And iugement to ry&yogh;tte. Betere red nys þer non here For to be crystes yuere, And hy&yogh; ine heuene blysse, Bote felþe of senne to by-vly, felþe (not folþe ) in MS. And bydde god and oure leuedy Þat hy ous helpe and wysse. For hyre poer nys nou&yogh;t y-lessed, Ac toup alle oþren hys y-blessed, Soþe wyf and mayde; Ase þat godspel telleþ ous, Benedicta tu in mulieribus , Eli&yogh;abeth hyt sayde. Al here ioyen a lok-sounday, And alle þe þät me aspye may, Þat hyre and erþe felle, and = an . Al fram crystes ascencioun, Al wat comþe hyre assumpcioun, To þyssere loungy schelle. ÞE fyfte ioye of oure leuedy Not er[þ]lych man hou hyt may by, Ne þer-of [may] more aspye, Bote þat þe gloriouse beerde Out of þyse world (þe) gloriouse ferde, ( þe ) omitted by Mätzner. Wyþ greate melodye. One-couþ to þe, man, hys þes figure, For þe offyce of hyre sepulture Was al an heuene gyse; And toller hys man to heuene speche Þanne be a best, þa&yogh; man hym teche Reyson and mannes wyse. Þer-fore nys þer-of naut y-wryte, For man ne mot nou&yogh;t her y-wyte Wat hys so he&yogh; a steuene; Ac holy cherche der wel by-knowe Þat hy ne þolede none deaþes þrowe, þrowe , MS. þro&yogh;e . Þat loweþ þat lyf of heuene. loweþ = lo&yogh;eþ , MS. lower , Mätzner lowerth . Hyt hys y-wryte þat angeles brytte To holy manne deaþe aly&yogh;te [Þet] her an erþe leye; In holy bok hys hyt inome Þat god hym self a wolde come, Wanne hy scholde deye. Þer-bye we mowe wel y-wyte, Þa&yogh; þer be nau&yogh;t of y-wryte, be MS. (Wr. he , Mätzner corr.). Þat cryst hym self was þere; Myd hym of heuene þe ferede, Þe eadi leuedy for to lede, Most here no fend offere. Hy wente vppe, my leue broþer, In body and soule, hyt nys non oþer, For cryst hys god and kende: Þat body þat he tok of hys o&yogh;en, Hou mytte hyt ligge a-mang þe lo&yogh;en, Wyþ-oute honour and mende? Þanne ich dar segge mid gode ry&yogh;te Þat alle þe court of heuene aly&yogh;tte Attare departynge; And cryst hym self a&yogh;eins hyre com, And body and saule op wyþ hym nom In-to hys wonyynge. Þat hy hys quen, ase ich er mende, þat , read þar; cp. p. 113, l. 417. Here grace hy may doun to ous sende, Hire ioye to fol-uelle. Ich hopye hy nele nau&yogh;t let ous spylle, For he hys al to hyre wylle Of ioye þat hijs þe welle. þat hijs repeated in MS. For of hyre wombe he hys þat frut, Were-of þes angeles habbeþ hare dut, And men hare holy fode; Eli&yogh;abeth, hy sede þys: " Et benedictus fructus ventris Tui, iesus þe gode." Of songe hys to þen ende y-brout, Of , Mätzner O ( a , indefinite article). Ase þou hest, soster, me by-so&yogh;t, Ase ich hene my&yogh;tte frede. Nou syng and byde þe heuene quene Þet hy ous brynge al out of tene At oure mest[e] nede. AmeN. Oretis pro anima Willelmi de Schorham, quondam vicarii de chart iuxta Ledes.
text.5: VI. [On the Virgin Mary.] MArye, mayde mylde and fre, Chambre of þe trynyte, One wyle lest to me, Ase ich þe grete wyþ songe; Þa&yogh; my fet on-clene be, MS. fet vn on clene, vn underdotted. My mes þou onder-fonge. Þou art quene of paradys, Of heuene, of erthe, of al þat hys; Þou bere þane kyng of blys, Wyþ-oute senne and sore; Þou hast y-ry&yogh;t þat was amys, Ywonne þat was y-lore. Þou ert þe coluere of noe, Þat broute þe braunche of olyue tre, In tokne þat pays scholde be By-tuexte god and manne; Suete leuedy, help þou me, Wanne ich schal wende hanne. Þou art þe bosche of synay, Þou art þe rytte sarray, Þou hast ybrou&yogh;t ous out of cry Of caleng of þe fende; Þou art crystes o&yogh;ene drury, And of dauyes kende. Þou ert þe slinge, þy sone þe ston Þat dauy slange golye op-on; Þou ert þe &yogh;erd al of aaron Me dreye ise&yogh; spryngynde : Wytnesse at ham euerechon Þat wyste of þyne chyldynge. Þou ert þe temple salomon, In þe wondrede gedeon, Þou hest ygladed symeon Wyþ þyne swete offrynge In þe temple atte auter ston, Wyþ ihesus, heuene kynge. Þou ert judith, þat fayre wyf, Þou hast abated al þat stryf, Olofernes wyþ hys knyf Hys heuede þou hym by-nome; Þou hest ysaued here lyf lyf , MS. lef . Þat to þe wylle come. Þou ert hester, þat swete þyng, And asseuer, þe ryche kyng, Þey heþ ychose to hys weddyng, þey = þe . And quene he heþ a-uonge; he , read þe ? For mardocheus, þy derlyng, For , not In (Wr.), is the reading of the MS. Syre aman was y-honge. Þe prophete ezechyel In hys boke hyt wytnesseþ wel, Þou ert þe gate so stronge so stel, Ac euere y-schet fram manne; Þou erte þe ry&yogh;te uayre rachel, Fayrest of alle wymman[ne]. By ry&yogh;te toknynge þou ert þe hel Of wan spellede danyel; Þou ert emaus, þe ryche castel, Þar resteþ alle werye : Ine þe restede emanuel, Of wan y-spekeþ ysaye. wan y-spekeþ , MS. wany spekeþ . Ine þe hys god by-come a chyld; Ine þe hys wreche by-come myld, Þat vnicorn þat was so wyld Aleyd hys of a cheaste : Þou hast y-tamed [hyt], and i-styld, y-tamed , MS. y tamend, n underdotted. Wyþ melke of þy breste. Ine þe apocalyps sent Iohn Ise&yogh; ane wymman, wyþ sonne by-gon, Þane mow[ n ]e al onder hyre ton, I-crouned wyþ tuel sterre; tuel , twelve; same form p. 61, l. 1726. Swych a leuedy nas neuere non, Swych , MS. swyl . Wyþ þane fend to werre. Ase þe sonne takeþ hyre pas Wyþ-oute breche þor&yogh;-out þat glas, Þy maydenhod, on-wemmed hyt was For bere of þyne chylde; Nou, swete leuedy of solas, To ous senfolle be þou mylde. Haue, leuedy, þys lytel songe, Þat out of senfol herte sprong; A&yogh;ens þe feend þou make me strong, And &yogh;yf me þy wyssynge; And þa&yogh; ich habbe y-do þe wrang, wrang [: strong : sprong : songe ]. The true Mid.-Kent forms are : wrang [: strang : sprang : sang ]. Þou graunte me amendynge. Oretis pro anima domini Roberti Grosseteyte, quondam Episcopi Lincolniae.
text.6: VII. On the Trinity, Creation, the Existence of Evil, Devils, Adam and Eve, &c. IN holy sauter me may rede Hou god þourwe þe prophete sede, Dauyd, y-wysse, Þat fol in hys herte sede : Read þat [ þe ] fole ? 'Þer nys no gode,' dar man nau&yogh;t drede To don amys. Seþþe hyt hys so, hyt hys grete doute Seþþe , MS. þesse . Þat þare be woxe of þare route Mani a fol, MS. Mani and fole . Þat weneþ ryt, wyþ-oute mysse, Þat þer nys god ine heuene blysse, Ne helle pool. helle , MS. lelle . Þat eny soche be crystene man, God for-bede! and nau&yogh;t for þan, We y-soeþ al day MS. wey soeþ . Þat menye y-crystnedde were, Kölbing proposes to put a colon after day in l. 15, and to write menye þat . Fareþ ryt ase hy nere Nau&yogh;t of þe fay. And manye of ham þat beþ so fel[l]e, Þat þa&yogh; me godne sckele hem telle, Nau&yogh;t hy&yogh;t ne ganþ : ganþ , read genþ (for geinþ )? See note. A&yogh;en hy clappeþ þys and þat, And manye of ham not neuere wat, Ne wat he menþ. To sechen hyt hys wel lytel prys sechen (dat. plur.), Kölbing sech . Reyson to telle, þet hys y-wys, Ac lete ham be; For, bote hy take a betere fay, For , Kölbing Ac . Atte last hy goþ to schame a-way, Me may hyt see. Ac &yogh;ef þou wenst, man, þat errour, Þat þare ne be no sauueour Ne oþer lyf, And hyt be for de-faute of lore, Lest now wat ich segge more, h (underdotted) after wat in MS. Wyþ-oute stryf. And &yogh;ef þou [be] ylered man, be supplied by Wright.— onderstan [ s ] t , in the following line, would rather suggest the ind. art ( ert ), but change of mood is found elsewhere. And onderstan[s]t &yogh;et al for þan No god ne be, Ich acsy þe a questioun, And, ase hyt longeþ to reysoun, And-swere þou me. Þe erthe hys heuy, wyþ-oute wylle, Þat wey y-seoþ, and by al stylle wey = we . To gonne þrop. Wat, hou fareþ hy þat hy nasynkeþ, Ase here kende were, hyt þynkeþ; þynkeþ in MS. (Wright þenkeþ ). Ho halt ys op? Ho = who . Herto me seyþ, and heþ ysed, To healde hy op hyt nys no ned, Ne neuere nes, For chisel, grauel, stones harde, Ande here depnysse ry&yogh;t dounwarde Hys endeles. Þat þat be fals me may aspye Þat þat , Kölbing; MS. Þa&yogh; þat . By wytnesse of philosophye And clerkes fele; And fals ich may hit prouie wel, Þer hyt hys ned, and were ich schel, By þysse skele. skele , MS. skyle .
